page.title: 18WILDLIFE IN ETTRICK VALLEY.
page.content: The wildlife in our part of the valley is plentiful.Since all the trees have been planted such a lot of different birds and animals have multiplied. When the fish come up from the sea you see quite a lot of herons, mink and goosanders chatching trout and salmon. After all of the sheep were taken off the trees were planted and the grass grew for the mice to eat.Plenty of mice get eaten by the kestrels and owls. Foxes and deer roam around the forests looking for something to eat. You see some of the foxes and deer at the edge of the forests where the grass is thick and green.
